channel.title: Changing steel dragon ints [317]
channel.description:
Hi, I Have a 317 server that has steel dragons already coded into it but they don't have the correct npc ints so they mess up alot. I added in the new npc ints and tried them out when using pnpc and using the emote but i can't find out how to change it so the npc uses them. I was going to try to add them in as a new npc but then it wouldn't make much scene because I don't have the npc models because its already coded into the source. [code]if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1 class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2 class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3 class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4 class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level }[/code] I have all the emotes for the dragon added in already but I cant change the emote that the npc uses cause its coded into to server [code]79 = walk 80 = melee atk with claw 81 = fire breath atk 89 = block 90 = stand 91 = melee atk with head 92 = dead[/code]
Here are the npc id that are not working right.
1590 Bronze_dragon 1591 Iron_dragon 1592 Steel_dragon
If anyone could tell me how to add it so I can make them go with the right ints or emotes or what ever you call it I would be infinitely grateful

item.title: Changing steel dragon ints [317]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Hi, I Have a 317 server that has steel dragons already coded into it but they don’t have the correct npc ints so they mess up alot. I added in the new npc ints and tried them out when using pnpc and using the emote but i can’t find out how to change it so the npc uses them. I was going to try to add them in as a new npc but then it wouldn’t make much scene because I don’t have the npc models because its already coded into the source.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1 class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2 class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3 class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4 class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level }
I have all the emotes for the dragon added in already but I cant change the emote that the npc uses cause its coded into to server

79 = walk 80 = melee atk with claw 81 = fire breath atk 89 = block 90 = stand 91 = melee atk with head 92 = dead

Here are the npc id that are not working right.

1590 Bronze_dragon
1591 Iron_dragon
1592 Steel_dragon

If anyone could tell me how to add it so I can make them go with the right ints or emotes or what ever you call it I would be infinitely grateful

Read full topic
